A pesar de su muerte y reanimación subsiguiente, los gholdakos mantienen muchos de sus rasgos como cíclopes vivos, incluyendo su hambre incesante, temperamento volátil, simplicidad y gran fuerza.

action->Tumultuous Flash.name: Destello tumultuoso
action->Tumultuous Flash.description:
Frecuencia una vez al día

Desencadenante El gholdako está a punto de tirar 1d20

Efecto En vez de tirar con normalidad, el gholdako hace una @Check[flat|dc:11], obteniendo un éxito crítico en la tirada desencadenante si tiene éxito o un fallo crítico si falla.

action->Blinding Breath.name: Aliento cegador
action->Blinding Breath.description:
El gholdako exhala un @Template[cone|distance:60]{cono de 60 pies (18 m)} de aliento nocivo que causa @Damage[7d8[void]|options:area-damage]{7d8 daño del vacío} (salvación @Check[reflex|dc:29|basic|options:area-effect]). Una criatura que falla su salvación también queda @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Cegada} hasta su próximo turno (o durante 1 minuto con un fallo crítico) pues una película lechosa cubre sus ojos.

El gholdako no puede usar Aliento cegador hasta dentro de [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Blinding Breath]]{1d4 asaltos}.

action->Infectious Visions.name: Visiones infecciosas
action->Infectious Visions.description: La primera vez en cada asalto que el gholdako daña a una criatura con un Golpe de garra, la criatura debe hacer una salvación de @Check[will|dc:27], pues su mente se ve asaltada por visiones horripilantes. Con un fallo, la criatura queda @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confusa} hasta el final de su siguiente turno. Con un éxito crítico, la criatura queda inmune durante 24 horas.

Ghost Pirate Captain.name: Capitán pirata fantasma
Ghost Pirate Captain.publicNotes:
Los muertos vivientes que merodean por los océanos en barcos abandonados son desde hace mucho amenazas que los marineros mantienen vigiladas. Además de corporales, algunos piratas muertos vivientes adoptan formas incorporales, especialmente si sus cuerpos sirvieron de alimento a los peces. Los capitanes de tripulación en particular son propensos a regresar de entre los muertos, quizá debido a su fuerte personalidad.

Atados al mundo tras su muerte por fuertes emociones que no han resuelto, los fantasmas acechan a los vivos como tristes ecos de sus antiguos yos.

action->Curse Ye Scallywags!.name: ¡Malditos seáis, canallas!
action->Curse Ye Scallywags!.description: Cuando el capitán pirata fantasma queda reducido a 0 PG, todas las criaturas en 60 pies (18 m) quedan sujetas (@Check[will|dc:25]) a un conjuro de @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.z2mfh3oPnfYqXflY]{{Maldición del marinero}. El capitán conocerá la ubicación de quienes sufran un fallo crítico hasta que se elimine la maldición, que termina si el fantasma es destruido de forma permanente.

action->Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
action->Rejuvenation.description: Cuando el capitán pirata fantasma es destruido, se vuelve a formar al cabo de [[/br 2d4 #Rejuvenation]]{2d4 días} en el buque o lugar al que está vinculado, completamente curado. Puede ser destruido totalmente si sus deseos se cumplen, lo que podría implicar que le derroten en una gran batalla o asegurarse de que su tesoro está bien oculto.

action->Ship Bound.name: Barco vinculado
action->Ship Bound.description: El fantasma está usualmente atado a un barco, incluso aunque está dañado más allá de cualquier reparación posible. No puede alejarse más de 120 pies (36 m) del barco o del lugar del naufragio.

action->Combat Current.name: Corriente de combate
action->Combat Current.description: El fantasma da un Golpe con su alfanje o ballesta de mano, luego Vuela hasta la mitad de su velocidad y da un Golpe con el otro ataque. Si se mueve a través de un enemigo mientras vuela, ese enemigo queda @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido} contra el segundo Golpe.

action->Savvy Joinin' Me Crew?.name: ¿Quieres unirte a mi tripulación?
action->Savvy Joinin' Me Crew?.description:
Desencadenante El fantasma reduce a una criatura viva a 0 PG con un Golpe cuerpo a cuerpo

Efecto La criatura hace una salvación de @Check[fortitude|dc:25]. Si falla, queda inconsciente, pero bajo el control del fantasma hasta que pierde el estado moribundo. El efecto acaba si la criatura pierde el estado moribundo. Si la criatura muere mientras está bajo este efecto, se une a la tripulación del fantasma en [[/gmr 1d4 #days]]{1d4 días}. Si el fantasma es destruido antes de que la criatura muera, la criatura se libra de tan terrible destino.

Ghost Stampede.name: Estampida fantasma
Ghost Stampede.description: Cuatro enormes calaveras de uros, enormes rumiantes salvajes, se alzan en el aire, cada una con un cuerpo fantasmal tras ella.
Ghost Stampede.disable: @Check[nature|dc:36] (maestro) para calmar a uno de los cuatro uros o @Check[religion|dc:40] (entrenado) para exorcizarlos.
Ghost Stampede.reset: La aparición se desactiva 1 minuto después de que todas las criaturas abandonan el área o si los cuatro uros son destruidos. Tras 1 hora, si al menos queda una de las calaveras de uro, la aparición se reactiva.
Ghost Stampede.routine: (4 acciones) Por cada cabeza de uro desarmada o destruida la aparición tiene una acción menos. En cada acción, un uro diferente se mueve hasta 60 pies (18 m) y da un Golpe de cuerno contra una criatura viva diferente. Una criatura impactada con un crítico por el cuerno también sufre @Damage[2d6[bleed]]{2d6 daño persistente por sangrado} y queda @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Tumbada}.

action->Defend Territory.name: Defender territorio
action->Defend Territory.description:
Desencadenante Una criatura se acerca a 10 pies (3 m) de la calavera de un uro

Efecto La calavera se alza en el aire, forma cuerpos fantasmales y muge airada. Cada criatura a @Template[emanation|distance:60]{60 pies (18 m)} de las calaveras de uros debe tener éxito en una salvación de @Check[will|dc:36]. Tras esto, la aparición tira iniciativa.

Éxito crítico La criatura no sufre ningún efecto.

Éxito La criatura queda @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Asustada 1}.

Fallo La criatura sufre @Damage[(1d12+6)[mental]]{1d12+6 daño mental} y queda @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Asustada 2}.

Fallo crítico La criatura sufre @Damage[(2d12+12)[mental]]{2d12+12 daño mental} y queda @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Asustada 4}.

Ghul.name: Ghul
Ghul.languages: una lengua de los Planos (normalmente, acuano, aurano, ígnaro o terrano)
Ghul.publicNotes: Las leyendas afirman que los dioses, en los primeros días de la creación, expulsaron a algunos genios malvados, avaros y glotones al Plano Material. Allí, los genios se transformaron en los primeros ghuls, muertos vivientes crueles que se alimentan de la carne de los vivos. La naturaleza avara y glotona de los primeros ghuls vive en ellos, maldiciéndoles con una insaciable necesidad de alimentarse. Acechan rutas de comercio, cementerios y otras localizaciones con buenos lugares para ocultarse y un flujo regular de viajeros. Desde allí, utilizan sus habilidades para confundir y cautivar a los transeúntes, atrayéndolos hacia sus guaridas donde pueden atiborrarse de su carne desprevenida. A diferencia de un gul, un ghul no devora cadáveres, se alimenta de los vivos.

action->Change Shape.description:
El ghul adopta la apariencia de una @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.tUWchW8dXavTFeBy]{hiena} pequeña o mediana. Esto no afecta a su Velocidad o sus Golpes. Los efectos o aptitudes que detectan la presencia de muertos vivientes no revelan al ghul como muerto viviente mientras está en esta forma.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Devour Flesh.name: Devorar carne
action->Devour Flesh.description:
Requisitos El ghul está adyacente a una criatura @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Agarrada} o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Neutralizada}

Efecto El ghul trata de comer una porción de la carne de la criatura. Da un Golpe de mandíbulas contra la criatura agarrada. Con un éxito, devora parte de la carne y recupera @Damage[3d6[healing]]{3d6 Puntos de Golpe}. La criatura agarrada queda @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drenada 1} (o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{{Drenada 2} con un éxito crítico). El consumo violento requiere que el ghul libere a la criatura de la que se alimenta. Un ghul puede recuperar PG de una criatura una vez por hora; para recuperar Puntos de Golpe de nuevo debe consumir carne de una criatura diferente.

action->Luring Laugh.name: Risa fascinante
action->Luring Laugh.description:
Requisitos el ghul está en su forma de hiena

Efecto El ghul emite una risa fascinante. Cada criatura en una @Template[emanation|distance:60]{emanación de 60 pies (18 m)} debe tener éxito en una salvación de @Check[will|dc:19] o queda @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinada}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenida} y se ve impulsada a moverse hacia el ghul en el turno de la criatura. Los efectos duran hasta el final del siguiente turno del ghul, pero éste puede usar @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3f5DMFu8fPiqHpRg]{Mantener un conjuro} sobre Risa fascinante. Si el ghul ataca, el estado fascinado termina únicamente para la criatura atacada. Con un éxito en la salvación, una criatura queda inmune temporalmente a la Risa fascinante durante 24 horas.

Glimpse Grave.name: Atisbo de la tumba
Glimpse Grave.description: Una lápida lleva el nombre de quienes la miran, haciendo que tengan un ataque al corazón.
Glimpse Grave.disable: @Check[religion|dc:45|name:Bendecir la lápida] (legendario) para bendecir la lápida u @Check[occultism|dc:50|name:Alejar a los espíritus] (entrenado) para alejar a los espíritus.
Glimpse Grave.stealth: (experto) para notar las palabras en la lápida.

action->Stop Heart.name: Detener el corazón
action->Stop Heart.description:
Desencadenante Una criatura lee o toca la lápida

Efecto La aparición causa @Damage[(8d10+44)[void]]{8d10+44 daño negativo} (salvación @Check[will|dc:47|basic]) a todas las criaturas a @Template[emanation|distance:60]{60 pies (18 m)} que pueden ver la lápida y saben leer en algún idioma. Con un fallo crítico, la criatura muere.

Grappling Spirit.name: Luchador fantasmal
Grappling Spirit.publicNotes: Cuando un gran gladiador o luchador encuentra su final, su alma puede demorarse por amor al combate o al deporte. Cada luchador fantasmal manifiesta una máscara que representa el legado del combatiente que fue en vida.

action->Warrior's Mask.name: Máscara del guerrero
action->Warrior's Mask.description: Un luchador fantasmal lleva una máscara que le permite abandonar su forma original y convertirse en un combatiente centrado únicamente en el combate. Esta máscara es casi corporal, lo que permite que la manipulen tanto criaturas corporales como incorporales. Una criatura que tiene al luchador fantasmal @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Agarrado} o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Neutralizado} puede quitarle la máscara como una acción de Interactuar si tiene éxito en una prueba de @Check[athletics|dc:29] contra la CD de Fortaleza del espíritu. Quitar la máscara hace que el espíritu entre en frenesí. El luchador fantasmal queda @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Acelerado} y puede usar su acción extra para Volar, hacer una @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Presa} o dar un Golpe. También obtiene un bonificador +4 por estatus a las tiradas de daño, y un penalizador -4 por estatus a la CA y a las salvaciones de Reflejos. Si se le vuelve a poner la máscara, el frenesí acaba.

action->Ghostly Grasp.name: Agarrón fantasmal
action->Ghostly Grasp.description: Un luchador fantasmal puede usar @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Presa} con criaturas corporales a pesar de ser incorporal. El luchador utiliza su prueba de Atletismo para Apresar de forma normal pero no puede utilizar Atletismo para otras acciones que requieren contacto físico, como @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SjmKHgI7a5Z9JzBx]{Abrir por la fuerza} o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Derribar}.

action->Submission Lock.name: Llave de sumisión
action->Submission Lock.description:
Requisitos El luchador fantasmal tiene a una criatura @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Apresada} o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Neutralizada}

Efecto El espíritu va minando la fuerza de su oponente con una presa sobrenatural. El luchador fantasmal hace una prueba de Atletismo para @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Apresar} a una criatura a la que tiene agarrada o neutralizada, sumando @Damage[(4d10+12)[void]]{4d10+12 daño del vacío}, según el resultado.

Éxito crítico La criatura sufre doble daño. Si ya está debilitada, queda @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Inconsciente}. Si no, queda @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Debilitada 2} hasta el final de su próximo turno y @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Debilitada 1} durante 1 minuto.

Éxito La criatura sufre daño completo y queda debilitada 1 hasta el final de su próximo turno.

action->Teleporting Clothesline.name: Teletransporte contra las cuerdas
action->Teleporting Clothesline.description:
Requisitos El luchador fantasmal tiene a una criatura @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Agarrada} o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Neutralizada}

Efectos El luchador fantasmal empuja a la criatura 15 pies (4,5 m) en línea recta. El luchador se teletransporta inmediatamente 20 pies (6 m) para interceptarla. Da un Golpe de mano fantasmal contra la criatura. Con un éxito, la criatura queda @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Tumbada}, y con un éxito crítico, también sufre @Damage[2d6[bludgeoning]]{2d6 daño contundente} al chocar contra el suelo.

action->Victory Celebration.name: Celebración de la victoria
action->Victory Celebration.description: Si un espíritu deja @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Inconsciente} a una criatura, cada criatura en una @Template[emanation|distance:60]{emanación de 60 pies (18 m)} que ha presenciado la victoria es objetivo de un @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.czO0wbT1i320gcu9]{Aplauso atronador} con @Check[will|dc:26|traits:mental,emotion,occult]. El espíritu debe gastar todas sus restantes acciones hasta el final del turno celebrándolo, y una nueva medalla o cinturón aparecerán sobre su forma incorporal.

Grasping Dead.name: Muerte aferrante
Grasping Dead.description: Las manos de los muertos se alzan desde el suelo aferrando y rasgando a las criaturas del área para arrastrarlas bajo tierra.
Grasping Dead.disable: @Check[religion|dc:22] (entrenado) para rezar ritualmente por los muertos u @Check[occultism|dc:24] (entrenado) para exorcizar la ira de los espíritus; se requieren dos pruebas con éxito para inutilizar la aparición
Grasping Dead.reset: La aparición se desactiva 1 minuto después de que todas las criaturas vivas abandonen el área. Tras una hora la aparición se rearma.
Grasping Dead.routine: (1 acción) Las manos aferrantes apalean a todas las criaturas del área causando @Damage[(2d6+7)[bludgeoning]]{2d6+7 daño contundente} (salvación @Check[reflex|dc:26|basic]). Con un fallo crítico, una criatura es arrastrada parcialmente bajo tierra, quedando @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Inmovilizada} hasta que [[/act escape dc=26]]{Huye}. Si ya está inmovilizada, se sumerge completamente y debe contener el aliento para evitar ahogarse.

action->Shifting Earth.name: Tierra cambiante
action->Shifting Earth.description:
Desencadenante Al menos dos criaturas entran en el área

Efecto La tierra se mueve salvajemente mientras las manos de los muertos se alzan desde el suelo. El área se convierte en terreno difícil. Las criaturas en el área quedan @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Tumbadas} a menos que pasen una salvación de @Check[reflex|dc:26]. Tras esto, la aparición tira iniciativa.

consumable->Arsenic.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.OIirLySQDLZgT15S]

This toxin is a compound of arsenic and other substances. You can't reduce your sickened condition while affected.

Activate A Interact (Ingested)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18]

Onset 10 minutes

Maximum Duration 5 minutes

Stage 1 @Damage[1d4[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Indispuesto 1} (1 minute)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Indispuesto 2} (1 minute)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Indispuesto 3} (1 minute)

consumable->Invisibility Potion.description: An invisibility potion is colorless and oddly lightweight. Upon drinking it, you gain the effects of a 2nd-rank invisibility spell.

backpack->Bag of Holding (Type I).name: Bag of Holding (Type I)
backpack->Bag of Holding (Type I).description:
Though it appears to be a cloth sack decorated with panels of richly colored silk or stylish embroidery, a bag of holding opens into an extradimensional space larger than its outside dimensions. The Bulk held inside the bag doesn't change the Bulk of the bag of holding itself. The amount of Bulk the bag's extradimensional space can hold depends on its type.

You can Interact with the bag of holding to stow items in it or remove them just like a mundane sack. Though the bag can hold a great amount of material, an object still needs to be able to fit through the opening of the sack to be stored inside.

If the bag is overloaded or broken, it ruptures and is ruined, causing the items inside to be lost forever. If it's turned inside out, the items inside spill out unharmed, but the bag must be put right before it can be used again. A living creature placed inside the bag has enough air for 10 minutes before it begins to suffocate, and it can attempt to Escape against a DC of 13. An item inside the bag provides no benefits unless it's retrieved first. An item in the bag can't be detected by magic that detects only things on the same plane.

Capacity 25 Bulk

action->Command Zombie.name: Command Zombie
action->Command Zombie.description:
Krant intones blasphemous words to gain control over a zombie he can see within 100 feet. A zombie that is mindless and not under someone else's control falls under his control automatically; otherwise, the zombie or its controller can attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:22] save to avoid being controlled (whichever has the higher modifier). The target zombie is temporarily immune for 24 hours if successful. The attempt fails if the zombie is the same level as Krant or higher.

The zombie remains controlled by Krant until either is destroyed. Krant can control up to 8 zombies at a time. If Krant would control a number of zombies over this limit, he chooses which to release.

action->Create Zombies.name: Create Zombies
action->Create Zombies.description:
Krant can create lesser zombies with a 1-hour ritual. During this time, Krant chants and performs an unholy dance over the corpses he intends to animate. Unlike normal rituals, this doesn't require a skill check or Cost. At the end of this hour, Krant can create one 1st- or 2nd-level zombie, or two zombies of level 0 or lower. These are automatically under Krant's control and count toward the limit of Command Zombie. Any zombies created by Krant still count toward the XP budget of an encounter normally.

Krant has created enough individual zombies to form shambler troops, which are effectively 4th-level creatures. Rather than creating them directly, he needed to train weaker zombies to work as troops.

Level -1 Zombies

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.Xo4IGzw28hivgMmM]{Zombie Shambler}

Level 0 Zombies

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.book-of-the-dead-bestiary.Actor.ZqZlji7aCGCGATMP]{Zombie Snake}

Level 1 Zombies

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.blog-bestiary.Actor.uPeDOylL6zsZKSIs]{Goblin Zombie}
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.aWiTcxAySoYjUP6T]{Plague Zombie}

Level 2 Zombies

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.book-of-the-dead-bestiary.Actor.qO20so7Mv2pmsLL1]{Husk Zombie}
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.WioQ6rOeMRuTOliY]{Zombie Brute}

action->Shamble Forth.name: Shamble Forth
action->Shamble Forth.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Each zombie controlled by Krant Strides 5 feet (or Burrows, Climbs, Flies, or Swims 5 feet if it has the corresponding movement type).

action->Whispering Scythe.name: Whispering Scythe
action->Whispering Scythe.description:
Trigger An undead controlled by Krant and within 20 feet of him is destroyed

Requirements Krant is holding his scythe

Effect Krant draws the creature's soul into his scythe. The next time he makes a scythe Strike, the soul is released and the Strike deals an extra @Damage[1d6[void]] damage. The scythe can hold only one soul at a time.

Hollow Serpent.name: Serpiente hueca
Hollow Serpent.publicNotes:
Una serpiente hueca es el cascarón seco y marchito de una enorme serpiente constrictora, animada por la magia para servir a sus amos. Según los textos sagrados más antiguos de los hombres serpiente, Ydersius alzó las primeras serpientes huecas. El dios tomó las pieles desechadas de grandes serpientes y las rellenó de hambre y odio, con un anhelo sin fondo por la vida mortal que nunca podría llenarse. A su debido tiempo, los sacerdotes de los hombres serpiente aprendieron a replicar el truco de su señor, y en los milenios que siguieron, el conocimiento se coló en las bibliotecas de otros nigromantes y brujos.

A pesar de su reputación amenazadora y gran poder, las serpientes huecas son una creación relativamente fácil. Fueron diseñadas primero y principalmente como guardianas, y los liches hombre serpiente de un nivel o poder suficiente a menudo van acompañados de serpientes huecas. Unas pocas han atacado por propia voluntad con el tiempo, normalmente debido a haber sobrevivido a su creador original. Empujadas por su hambre y su tenue intelecto, se asientan en ruinas remotas o cavernas profundas. Quienes las estudian creen que al menos una serpiente, quizá una de las creadas originalmente por Ydersius, sobrevive en las montañas de Geb.

spell->Vampiric Exsanguination (Drawing.name: Desangramiento vampírico (drenando humedad en vez de sangre)

action->Desiccation Aura.name: Aura de desecación
action->Desiccation Aura.description: 30 pies (9 m). Una nube de acre polvo asfixiante se arremolina sobre la serpiente hueca, drenando la humedad de cualquier enemigo en ella. Una criatura que entre o empiece su turno dentro del aura deberá tener éxito en una salvación de @Check[fortitude|dc:34] o quedará @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Debilitado 2} y @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Lentificado 1} durante [[/r 1d4 #asaltos]]{1d4 asaltos} ([[/r 2d4 #asaltos]]{2d4 asaltos} con un fallo crítico). Una criatura que tiene éxito en la salvación queda inmune temporalmente durante 24 horas.

action->Divine Guardian.name: Guardiana divina
action->Divine Guardian.description:
Desencadenante Un aliado es atacado dentro del alcance de la serpiente hueca

Efecto La serpiente interpone un anillo de su cuerpo o su cola entre el aliado y el atacante. El atacante desencadenante golpea a la serpiente hueca en vez de a su objetivo original.

action->Slithering Strike.name: Golpe serpenteante
action->Slithering Strike.description: La serpiente hueca da una Zancada o Trepa y da un Golpe de mandíbulas al final de su movimiento. Si empieza su acción @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Escondida}, sigue escondida hasta después del Golpe con su aptitud.

Horde Lich.name: Horde Lich
Horde Lich.publicNotes:
At first glance, a horde lich looks like a skeleton packed with too many bones. In combat, the true purpose of these extra parts becomes clear as limbs peel off, expanding and reassembling into another nimble skeletal form. Regardless of the number, the single lich mind controls them all, and if any of them survive an encounter, they can rebuild the whole given enough time and raw materials.

A desire to live eternally motivates a spellcaster to become a lich, and necromantic knowledge makes the desire real. The typical lich takes the most direct path, keeping their undead form fairly close to their appearance in life. But undeath can also bring greater freedom for those with a less conventional view of what they can become. The horde lich and runecarved lich reshape themselves entirely.
Horde Lich.saveDetails: +1 status to all saves vs. vitality

spell->Veil.name: Veil
spell->Veil.description:
You disguise the targets as other creatures of the same body shape and roughly similar height (within 6 inches) and weight (within 50 pounds). The disguise can hide the targets' identities or let them appear to be of another ancestry, but it's not precise enough to impersonate specific individuals. The spell doesn't change voice, scent, or mannerisms. You choose the disguise for each target; for example, you could make one target appear to be a dwarf and another an elf. Casting veil counts as setting up a disguise for the purpose of the Impersonate action. It allows the target to ignore any circumstance penalties they might take for being disguised as dissimilar creatures, and it gives the targets a +4 status bonus to Deception checks to prevent others from seeing through their disguises, and add their level even if untrained. You can Dismiss any or all of these disguises.

Heightened (5th) The spell also disguises the targets' voices and scents; it gains the auditory and olfactory traits.

Heightened (7th) The targets can appear as any creature of the same size, even specific individuals. You must have seen an individual to reproduce their appearance. The spell also disguises the targets' voices and scents; it gains the auditory and olfactory traits.

consumable->Scroll of Teleport (Level 6).name: Scroll of Teleport (Level 6)
consumable->Scroll of Teleport (Level 6).consumableSpellDescription:
You and the targets are instantly transported to any location within range, as long as you can identify the location precisely both by its position relative to your starting position and by its appearance (or other identifying features). Incorrect knowledge of the location's appearance usually causes the spell to fail, but it could instead lead to teleporting to an unwanted location or some other unusual mishap determined by the GM. Teleport is not precise over great distances. The targets appear at a distance from the intended destination equal to roughly 1 percent of the total distance traveled, in a direction determined by the GM. For short journeys, this lack of precision is irrelevant, but for long distances this could be up to 1 mile.

Heightened (7th) You and the other targets can travel to any location within 1,000 miles.

Heightened (8th) You and the other targets can travel to any location on the same planet. If you travel more than 1,000 miles, you arrive only 10 miles off target.

Heightened (9th) You and the other targets can travel to any location on another planet within the same solar system. Assuming you have accurate knowledge of the location's position and appearance, you arrive on the new planet 100 miles off target.

Heightened (10th) As the 9th-rank version, but you and the other targets can travel to any planet within the same galaxy.
consumable->Scroll of Teleport (Level 6).consumableSpellTarget: you and up to 4 targets touched, either willing creatures or objects roughly the size of a creature.
consumable->Scroll of Teleport (Level 6).description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.4sGIy77COooxhQuC]

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.69L70wKfGDY66Mk9]{Teleport}

Casting a Spell from a scroll requires holding the scroll in one hand and activating it with a Cast a Spell activity using the normal number of actions for that spell.

To Cast a Spell from a scroll, the spell must appear on your spell list. Because you're the one Casting the Spell, use your spell attack roll and spell DC. The spell also gains the appropriate trait for your tradition (arcane, divine, occult, or primal).

Any physical material components and costs are provided when a scroll is created, so you don't need to provide them when Casting a Spell from a scroll. You must replace any required material component for that spell with a somatic component. If the spell requires a focus, you must have that focus to Cast the Spell from a scroll.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.

consumable->Wand of Dispel Magic (Level.name: Wand of Dispel Magic (Level 6)
consumable->Wand of Dispel Magic (Level.consumableSpellDescription: You unravel the magic behind a spell or effect. Attempt a counteract check against the target. If you successfully counteract a magic item, the item becomes a mundane item of its type for 10 minutes. This doesn't change the item's non-magical properties. If the target is an artifact or similar item, you automatically fail.
consumable->Wand of Dispel Magic (Level.consumableSpellTarget: 1 spell effect or unattended magic item
consumable->Wand of Dispel Magic (Level.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.kiXh4SUWKr166ZeM]

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic}

This baton is about a foot long and contains a single spell. The appearance typically relates to the spell within.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You Cast the Spell at the indicated level.

Craft Requirements Supply a listed-level casting of the spell.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Vital.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Vitality

action->Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
action->Rejuvenation.description: When a lich is destroyed, its soul immediately transfers to its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.NEbr7nKuiluJgBHT]{Soul Cage}. A lich can be permanently destroyed only if its soul cage is found and destroyed.

action->Shatter Block.name: Shatter Block
action->Shatter Block.description:
Trigger A creature scores a critical hit on the horde lich

Requirements The horde lich has at least one servitor attached (see Servitor Assembly)

Effect The critical hit is a normal hit instead. One of the horde lich's servitors detaches from them and is placed in an open, adjacent space, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Tumbado}. The servitor takes the damage from the triggering attack.

action->Servitor Assembly.name: Servitor Assembly
action->Servitor Assembly.description:
A horde lich has three servitor bodies folded up and attached to themself, usually in the ribcage, on the arms, and around the legs. The lich detaches one of these servitors and places it in any open, adjacent space. The lich can alternatively take this action to reattach an adjacent servitor.

The lich and their servitors share actions and Hit Points, and the servitors use the same statistics as the lich. Spells and effects that target the lich or their servitors affect all of them equally, but they're still treated as just one creature when targeted by spells and attacks. The horde lich attempts only one save against such effects, but they take a -2 circumstance penalty to defend against effects that target both the lich and one or more detached servitors. Whenever the horde lich Casts a Spell, they can choose to have the spell originate from themself or from any one of their detached servitors. If the horde lich is destroyed, all attached servitors are destroyed as well. If a servitor is dealt a critical hit, it's destroyed (and the horde lich takes the damage as normal).

action->Servitor Attack.name: Servitor Attack
action->Servitor Attack.description: Each of the horde lich's detached servitors Strike, with a -2 circumstance penalty on the attack roll. Each of these Strikes counts toward the lich's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks.

action->Servitor Lunge.name: Servitor Lunge
action->Servitor Lunge.description:
Requirements The horde lich's last action was a critical hit with a melee Strike, and the horde lich has at least one servitor attached

Effect One of the lich's attached servitors detaches adjacent to the target, and the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Agarrado} by that servitor.

action->Servitor Realignment.name: Servitor Realignment
action->Servitor Realignment.description: Each of the horde lich's detached servitors can either Interact or take a basic action with the move trait. The lich chooses which action each of them takes.

action->Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
action->Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt the horde lich's spellcasting action, the lich attempts a @Check[type:flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

Hunter Wight.name: Hunter Wight
Hunter Wight.publicNotes:
Dangers deep in the wilderness claim the life some lone scout or hunter. When they arise as wights, they renew their hunt with equal vigor, but all the living are now their prey. Hunter wights prefer to seek strategic ground, frequently taking residence atop hills or within abandoned watchtowers and keeps.

Wights are undead beings of spite who primarily stalk places related to death.

equipment->Snare Kit.name: Snare Kit
equipment->Snare Kit.description: This kit contains tools and materials for creating snares. A snare kit allows you to Craft snares using the Crafting skill.

action->Final Snare.name: Final Snare
action->Final Snare.description:
Trigger The hunter wight is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The hunter wight has rigged their own body with a snare, which they trigger before being destroyed. Slivers of bone launch at an adjacent creature, dealing @Damage[4d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:25|basic:true]).

action->Drain Life.name: Drain Life
action->Drain Life.description: When the hunter wight damages a living creature using an unarmed attack or their bound weapon, they gain 7 temporary Hit Points, and the creature must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drenado 1}. Further damage dealt by the hunter wight's unarmed and bound weapon attacks increases the value of the drained condition by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

action->Spawn Hunter Wight.name: Spawn Hunter Wight
action->Spawn Hunter Wight.description: A living humanoid killed by a hunter wight's weapon or claw Strike rises as a hunter wight spawn after [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. This spawn is under the command of the hunter wight that killed them. They don't have drain life or spawn hunter wight and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Torpe 2} for as long as they're a hunter wight spawn. If the creator of the hunter wight spawn dies, the hunter wight spawn becomes a fully autonomous hunter wight; they regain their free will, gain drain life and spawn hunter wight, and are no longer clumsy

Husk Zombie.name: Husk Zombie
Husk Zombie.publicNotes:
Rather than allow a body to rot, some necromancers attempt to dry-cure the corpse to prevent further deterioration. Combined with special reagents, this process can preserve a rudimentary form of intelligence, allowing husk zombies to act more like predators than their mindless kin. Most husk zombies have no memories of their prior lives, though some keep trinkets from that time, oblivious as to why they value such items. A rare few husk zombies retain most of their former knowledge, though they tend to have gaps in their memory.

Simple to create and varied in purpose, these shambling undead are often used for their strength and endless stamina to conduct boring, repetitive tasks.

condition->Slowed.description: You have fewer actions. Slowed always includes a value. When you regain your actions at the start of your turn, reduce the number of actions you regain by your slowed value. Because slowed has its effect at the start of your turn, you don't immediately lose actions if you become slowed during your turn.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A husk zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Lentificado 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Sneak Attack.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.AWvNPE4U0kEJSL1T]

The husk zombie deals an additional 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido} creatures.

action->Sudden Surge.name: Sudden Surge
action->Sudden Surge.description:
Trigger The husk zombie's turn begins

Effect The husk zombie has a sudden burst of speed. They are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Acelerado} this turn and can use the extra action only to Stride or Strike. If the husk zombie's first action this turn is a melee Strike, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido} against the attack.

The husk zombie can't use Sudden Surge again until after they spend at least 10 minutes standing motionless.

Ice Mummy.name: Ice Mummy
Ice Mummy.languages: plus any two languages they knew while alive
Ice Mummy.publicNotes:
The cold of high places coupled with strong winds and less oxygen creates an effect that can preserve bodies, mummifying them through natural processes. Many are created deliberately by cults, and a rare few voluntarily transform.

The versatility of mummification allows the creation of mummies through a wide range of methods—nature, ritual, alchemy, and combinations of all these.

action->Great Despair.name: Great Despair
action->Great Despair.description:
30 feet. Living creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Asustado 1} while in an ice mummy's great despair aura. They can't naturally recover from this fear while in the area but recover instantly once they leave it. When a creature first enters the area, it must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:24] save (after taking the penalty from being frightened) or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralizado} for [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. The creature is then temporarily immune for 24 hours.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.1bOSJ2LbEC28aI9f]{Effect: Despair}

action->Snow Vision.name: Snow Vision
action->Snow Vision.description: The ice mummy ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Oculto} condition from falling snow.

action->Channel Rot.name: Channel Rot
action->Channel Rot.description: The ice mummy can deliver cold rot through melee weapons they wield.

action->Cold Rot.name: Cold Rot
action->Cold Rot.description:
This affliction can't be reduced below stage 1, nor can damage from it be healed, until successfully treated with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SUKaxVZW2TlM8lu0]{Cleanse Affliction} or a similar effect. The affliction can then be removed as normal for a disease. A creature killed by cold rot turns to ice crystals and can't be resurrected except by a 7th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kqhPt9344UkcGVYO]{Resurrect} ritual or similar magic

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:24]

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Lentificado 1} for 1 round, then carrier with no ill effect (1 minute)

Stage 2 @Damage[5d6[void],2d6[cold]]{5d6 void damage plus 2d6 cold damage} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Anonadado 2} (1 day)

action->Frozen Breath.name: Frozen Breath
action->Frozen Breath.description:
The ice mummy exhales a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] of razor-sharp ice that deals @Damage[5d6[cold],4d6[slashing]]{5d6 cold and 4d6 slashing damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:26|basic:true]).

The ice mummy can't use Frozen Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Frozen Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Ichor Slinger.name: Vendeicores
Ichor Slinger.publicNotes: Aunque el típico vendedor de curalotodo busca enriquecerse, algunos estafadores se enamoran tanto de esta forma de vida que vuelven a la vida para seguir viviendo de la mentira. Conocidos como vendeicores, estos alquimistas cadavéricos se disfrazan para poder moverse entre los vivos con normalidad. Preparan tónicos y venden pociones curalotodo alegremente, convenciendo con su carisma a los transeúntes para que no se fijen en los cuestionables ingredientes y credenciales. Los vendeicores se alimentan de la atención y la confianza de la gente y, les preocupa poco la salud de sus clientes mientras consigan que los compradores se tomen las medicinas ofrecidas. Por contra, el rechazo los enfurece. Los muertos vivientes a menudo asaltan, dominan y administran medicinas no deseadas a quienes los desaíran. Cuando no están vendiendo «panaceas», los vendeicores recolectan ingredientes macabros para elaborar nuevas medicinas sospechosas.

equipment->Alchemist's Tools.name: Material de alquimista
equipment->Alchemist's Tools.description: Esta colección móvil de frascos y productos químicos se puede utilizar para tareas alquímicas sencillas.

equipment->Disguise Kit.description: Esta pequeña caja de madera contiene cosméticos, pelo postizo, pegamento para la piel y algunas pelucas sencillas. Normalmente se necesita un material de disfraces para crear un disfraz con el fin de suplantar a alguien utilizando la habilidad Engaño. Si has creado un gran número de disfraces, puedes reponer tus suministros de cosméticos con cosméticos de repuesto adecuados para el tipo de material de disfraces que tengas.

consumable->Snake Oil.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.xBZCVHAa1SnR8Xul]

Activar A Interactuar

Puedes aplicar aceite de serpiente sobre una herida u otro síntoma externo de una afección o dolencia (como llagas causadas por una enfermedad o decoloración por un veneno). Durante la siguiente hora, el síntoma desaparece y la criatura herida o afectada no siente que todavía tiene la herida o la dolencia, aunque todos los efectos permanecen. Una criatura puede descubrir el engaño si supera una tirada de @Check[perception|dc:17|traits:action:seek], pero solo si utiliza una acción de Buscar para examinar específicamente los efectos del aceite de serpiente.

action->Mystery Ingredients.name: Ingredientes misteriosos
action->Mystery Ingredients.description: 60 pies (18 m). Las criaturas en el aura sufren un penalizador -2 por estatus para las pruebas de Identificar Alquimia, Recordar conocimiento sobre temas alquímicos o examinar los efectos del aceite de serpiente. Cuando una criatura entra por primera vez en el área, si oye hablar al vendeicores, debe tener éxito en una salvación secreta de Voluntad contra la CD de Engañar del vendeicores. Con un fallo, tratará la siguiente prueba fallida, en las próximas 24 horas, para Identificar Alquimia o Recordar conocimiento sobre temas alquímicos como si fuera un fallo crítico. Este es un efecto auditivo de desventura.

action->Brew Tomb Juice.name: Destilar zumo de tumba
action->Brew Tomb Juice.description:
Coste 1 lote de reactivos infundidos

Efecto El vendeicores crea un vial de zumo de tumba, un tónico que tiene el rasgo infundido y queda inerte tras 24 horas. El zumo de tumba tiene los mismos efectos del @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.xBZCVHAa1SnR8Xul]{Aceite de serpiente}, o quizá más dependiendo del resultado de la prueba de @Check[crafting|dc:20] del vendeicores.

Éxito crítico El vendeicores elige uno de los siguientes objetos y añade sus efectos al zumo de tumba: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.AJ1dC7EtTIfBey0M]{Antídoto moderado}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.biRbqKo2C97XLfQ0]{Antiplaga moderado}, elixir de vida menor, veneno de escorpión gigante o mutágeno de juggernaut moderado. Los venenos creados de esta forma tienen una incubación de 1 asalto, el rasgo ingerido y pierden cualquier rasgo de contacto, inhalación o herida que tuvieran.

Éxito Como con éxito crítico, pero elige entre antídoto menor, antiplaga menor, elixir de vida mínimo, raíz de sepultura o mutágeno de juggernaut menor.

action->Exhume.name: Exhumar
action->Exhume.description:
Requisitos El vendeicores está adyacente a una criatura muerta que aún no está afectada por Exhumar

Efecto El vendeicores recolecta porciones del cadáver para obtener 1 dosis de reactivos infundidos o 2 dosis si la criatura era un muerto viviente.

action->Force Feed.name: Alimentar a la fuerza
action->Force Feed.description:
Requisitos El vendeicores tiene a una criatura @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Agarrada} o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Neutralizada} y tiene en la mano un zumo de tumba, elixir alquímico o veneno alquímico

Efecto El vendeicores obliga al objetivo a consumir la sustancia alquímica.

Iroran Mummy.name: Iroran Mummy
Iroran Mummy.languages: any two languages they knew while alive
Iroran Mummy.publicNotes:
Some enlightened members of the Iroran faith, particularly monks, are so aware of their own bodily processes they can sense their approaching death from old age. Pinpointing the occurrence to the exact hour, a chosen few employ a method of self-mummification. These masters of life and death leave behind their bodies to watch over Irori's temples.

The versatility of mummification allows the creation of mummies through a wide range of methods—nature, ritual, alchemy, and combinations of all these.

action->Aura of Peace.name: Aura of Peace
action->Aura of Peace.description: 30 feet. When a creature enters or starts its turn in the aura, it's affected by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.b515AZlB0sridKSq]{Calm} for 1 minute, with a @Check[type:will|dc:27] save. A creature that succeeds at the save is temporarily immune for 24 hours. If the Iroran mummy takes a hostile action, the aura of peace is suppressed and its effects end for anyone already affected. The Iroran mummy must spend 10 minutes in meditation to restore the aura.

action->Robe Tangle.name: Robe Tangle
action->Robe Tangle.description:
Trigger An adjacent creature misses the Iroran mummy with a melee Strike

Effect The mummy swaps positions with the attacker, and the attacker becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Agarrado} by the mummy's animated sash. The Escape DC is 29, the Force Open DC is 27, and a creature can sever the sash by hitting AC 27 and dealing at least 20 slashing damage. The mummy can't use this reaction again until they've Interacted to reclaim the sash.

action->Stunning Flurry.name: Stunning Flurry
action->Stunning Flurry.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The Iroran mummy makes two unarmed Strikes. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses, and the target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:29|traits:incapacitation] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Aturdido 1} (or stunned 3 on a critical failure); this save has the incapacitation trait.

Iruxi Ossature.name: Osamenta Iruxi
Iruxi Ossature.publicNotes:
Los iruxi, también conocidos como hombres lagarto, están rodeados por los espíritus de sus antepasados (literalmente) puesto que honran a sus muertos incorporando sus huesos a la arquitectura de los asentamientos iruxi. Décadas de veneración por sus descendientes ha provocado que el poder primigenio se acumule en dichos restos. En momentos de crisis, los huesos incrustados en la tierra cobran vida como guardianes de último recurso. Los iruxis se refieren a menudo a estos muertos vivientes (como espíritus de hueso y roca bañados en la luz de la mañana, impulsados por las creencias de los vivos) como los «guardianes del crepúsculo».

Las osamentas iruxi normalmente se reaniman de forma espontánea cuando se viola una cámara de anidación o se derrama sangre en la sala principal del asentamiento. Los asentamientos realmente antiguos pueden estar bendecidos con la presencia de unas pocas osamentas en todo momento: protegiendo los viveros, relicarios y observatorios sagrados en los que sus descendientes estudian los cielos. Estas osamentas particularmente duras están compuestas de huesos fosilizados y tienen adornos protectores, cuernos o colas con pinchos similares a las de los dinosaurios.

action->Twilight Spirit.name: Espíritu del crepúsculo
action->Twilight Spirit.description: La fe de sus descendientes protege a la osamenta iruxi. No sufre daño por vitalidad o vacío y puede ser curado por vitalidad y vacío.

action->Fossil Fury.name: Furia fósil
action->Fossil Fury.description:
Frecuencia una vez por hora

Efecto La osamenta iruxi hace señas con manos luminosas, ordenando a la tierra que derribe a sus oponentes y a las paredes de hueso de su protectorado que arremetan contra los intrusos. El suelo en un @Template[cone|distance:30]{cono de 30 pies (9 m)} frente a la osamenta se convierte en terreno difícil durante 1 minuto. Cualquier casilla en la que hay una pared construida por iruxis que esté en el cono ataca con garras fosilizadas, dañando a cualquier enemigo que está a 5 pies (1,5 m) o menos de la pared. Causa @Damage[6d6[piercing]|options:area-damage]{6d6 daño perforante} con una salvación @Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|options:area-effect]. Una criatura puede hacer una salvación una única vez, incluso aunque esté adyacente a más de una pared. La Furia fósil no tiene efecto en los aliados de la osamenta y nunca daña a los huevos de iruxi.

action->Terrain Advantage.name: Ventaja de terreno
action->Terrain Advantage.description: Las criaturas que no sean hombres lagarto y estén en terreno difícil, o en el agua y carezcan de una velocidad de nadar, estarán @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenidas} ante la osamenta iruxi.

action->Totems of the Past.name: Tótems del pasado
action->Totems of the Past.description:
La osamenta iruxi proyecta visiones hechas de luz estelar que parecen pinturas totémicas o diagramas de constelaciones, sobre todas las criaturas en una @Template[emanation|distance:30]{emanación de 30 pies (9 m)}. Cualquier hombre lagarto aliado en el área se verá inspirado por ellas, obteniendo un bonificador +1 por estatus a las tiradas de ataque y cada enemigo en el área debe tener éxito en una salvación de @Check[will|dc:21] o queda @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Deslumbrado}. Ambos efectos duran 1 minuto o hasta que la osamenta es destruida, lo que ocurre antes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.UuEUZU1fSUb23yOk]{Efecto: Tótems del pasado}

Jitterbone Contortionist.name: Jitterbone Contortionist
Jitterbone Contortionist.publicNotes:
Aptly named jitterbones, halfling mortics are capable of controlling the density and rigidity of their skeletal structure. When relaxed, they have elongated, rubbery limbs. When they harden their bones, they become difficult to harm and bony spikes jut from their flesh.

Mortics are humanoids overwhelmed by void energy who tenaciously cling to life, straddling the line between living and dead.

action->Consecration Vulnerability.name: Consecration Vulnerability
action->Consecration Vulnerability.description: A jitterbone in a place of worship dedicated to a non-evil deity or on sacred ground, such as an area blessed by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.y3jlOfgsQH1JjkJE]{Sanctified Ground}, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Lentificado 1}.

action->Compression.name: Compression
action->Compression.description: The jitterbone can move through a gap at least 6 inches wide without Squeezing and can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeeze} through a gap at least 2 inches wide.When the jitterbone successfully Squeezes, they move through the tight space at full Speed. Narrow confines aren't difficult terrain for a jitterbone.

action->Death Gasp.name: Death Gasp
action->Death Gasp.description:
The jitterbone draws in a deep breath and holds it, temporarily suspending their biological processes and becoming undead. The jitterbone gains the undead trait and becomes immune to bleed, death effects, disease, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralizado}, poison, and sleep. Any such effects the jitterbone is currently inflicted with are suspended but take effect again once they take a breath.

Death Gasp lasts as long as the jitterbone holds their breath (up to 8 rounds).

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.lyeRL7khixdlJsaf]{Effect: Death Gasp}

action->Osseous Defense.name: Osseous Defense
action->Osseous Defense.description:
The jitterbone elongates their bones, causing jagged bone spikes to protrude from their skin. While Osseous Defense is active, the jitterbone can make bone spike and bone dart Strikes and gains resistance 5 to piercing damage and slashing damage. The jitterbone loses Compression while their Osseous Defense is active. The jitterbone can end Osseous Defense as a single action, retracting their bones back into their body.

Melee 1 bone spike +14 (finesse), Damage 2d8+2 piercing plus 1d6 persistent bleed

Ranged 1 bone dart +14 (agile, thrown 20 feet), Damage 2d6+2 piercing

Lacedon.name: Lacedon
Lacedon.publicNotes:
Temidos por los marineros y los habitantes de las costas de todo el mundo, se dice que los guls acuáticos conocidos como lacedones son la prole de una antigua tripulación de marineros que se perdió en el mar y se vió obligada a recurrir al canibalismo para sobrevivir. Su apariencia es la pesadilla de un buzo, complementando los crueles rasgos de sus parientes terrestres con espinas, aletas y grandes bocas llenas de dientes afilados como agujas, similares a los depredadores marinos de las grandes profundidades oceánicas.

Se puede encontrar a los taimados y astutos guls en cualquier lugar en el que hay cadáveres sepultados, tratando de satisfacer su inagotable hambre de carne humanoide.

action->Corpse Scent (Imprecise) 1 mile.name: Oler cadáver (impreciso) 1 milla (1,6 km)
action->Corpse Scent (Imprecise) 1 mile.description: El lacedon puede oler cadáveres humanoides en el agua hasta a 1 milla (1,6 km) de distancia.

action->Consume Flesh.name: Consumir carne
action->Consume Flesh.description:
Requisitos El lacedon está adyacente al cadáver de una criatura que ha muerto en la última hora

Efecto El lacedon devora un pedazo del cadáver y recupera @Damage[2d6[healing]]{2d6 Puntos de Golpe}. Puede recuperar Puntos de Golpe una sola vez por cadáver.

action->Ghoul Fever.name: Fiebre del gul
action->Ghoul Fever.description:
Salvación @Check[fortitude|dc:16]

Etapa 1 portador sin síntomas negativos (1 día)

Etapa 2 @Damage[2d6[void]]{2d6 daño del vacío} y recupera la mitad de Puntos de Golpe de cualquier curación (1 día)

Etapa 3 igual que la etapa 2 (1 día)

Etapa 4 @Damage[2d6[void]]{2d6 daño del vacío} y no puede beneficiarse de curación (1 día)

Etapa 5 igual que la etapa 4 (1 día)

Etapa 6 muere y se alza como un @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{Gul} la medianoche siguiente.

action->Paralyzing Spew.name: Vómito paralizante
action->Paralyzing Spew.description: El lacedon expulsa una rociada de vómito a una criatura a una distancia máxima de 20 pies (6 m), causando @Damage[1d6[poison]]{1d6 daño por veneno} con una salvación @Check[fortitude|dc:17|basic|options:inflicts:paralyzed]. Cualquier criatura viva que no sea un elfo que falla su prueba de salvación también queda @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralizada}. Puede hacer una nueva salvación al final de cada uno de sus turnos y la CD se reduce en 1 de forma acumulativa con cada salvación. El lacedon no puede utilizar de nuevo Vómito paralizante durante [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Paralyzing Spew]]{1d4 asaltos}.

Last Guard.name: Guardia final
Last Guard.hpDetails: curación del vacío, rejuvenecimiento, defensas de tropa

action->Battlefield Bound.name: Atado al campo de batalla
action->Battlefield Bound.description: Sin una llamada a la guerra, la guardia final solo puede alejarse a una corta distancia del lugar que fracasó en defender, normalmente unos 120 pies (36 m). Algunas guardias finales están atadas a una provincia, reino o nación en vez de a un lugar concreto.

action->Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenecimiento
action->Rejuvenation.description: Cuando una guardia final es destruida, se reforma en [[/br 2d4 #days]]{2d4 días} en el lugar al que está atada, totalmente curada. Una guardia final solo puede ser destruida de forma permanente y descansar en paz si tiene éxito en defender el lugar al que está atada de un ataque a gran escala o acude a una llamada a la guerra.

action->Frightful Battle Cry.name: Grito de guerra pavoroso
action->Frightful Battle Cry.description:
La guardia final lanza un bramido conjunto estremecedor. Todas las criaturas en un @Template[cone|distance:60]{cono de 60 pies (18 m)} sufren @Damage[7d6[sonic]|options:area-damage]{7d6 daño sónico} (salvación @Check[will|dc:42|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:frightened]). Cualquier criatura que falla su salvación también queda @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Asustada 3} (o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Asustada 4} con un fallo crítico).

Si la guardia ocupa 8 casillas o menos, esta área se reduce a un @Template[cone|distance:30]{cono de 30 pies (9 m)}.

action->Ghostly Blades.name: Hojas fantasma
action->Ghostly Blades.description:
1 to 3

Frecuencia una vez por asalto

Efecto La guardia final inicia un ataque coordinado con sus espadas curvas fantasmales contra cada enemigo que está a @Template[emanation|distance:5]{5 pies (1,5 m}; salvación @Check[reflex|dc:40|basic|options:area-effect]). El daño depende del número de acciones.

1 @Damage[(1d8+2)[slashing],1d8[void]]{1d8+2 cortante y 1d8 vacío}

2 @Damage[(2d8+14)[slashing],2d8[void]]{2d8+14 cortante y 2d8 vacío}

3 @Damage[(3d8+14)[slashing],3d8[void]]{3d8+14 cortante y 3d8 vacío}

action->Spectral Charge.name: Carga espectral
action->Spectral Charge.description: La guardia final carga, pululando entre sus enemigos. La tropa vuela hasta el doble de su velocidad, causando @Damage[4d8[void]]{4d8 daño del vacío} a toda criatura a través de cuyo espacio se mueve (salvación @Check[reflex|dc:40|basic|options:inflicts:drained]). Cualquier criatura que falla su salvación también queda @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drenada 1} (o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drenada 2} con un fallo crítico). La tropa puede afectar a cada criatura solo una vez con un uso de Carga espectral.

action->Troop Movement.name: Movimiento de tropa
action->Troop Movement.description: Cada vez que la tropa da una Zancada, primero realiza Formación como acción gratuita para condensarse en un área de 20x20 pies (6x6 m) menos cualquier casilla faltante, luego mueve su velocidad. Esto funciona igual que el movimiento de una criatura Gargantuesca.

Little Man In The Woods.name: Little Man In The Woods
Little Man In The Woods.publicNotes:
A murdered man left unburied in the wilds might return as a being called a "little man in the woods," his decayed corpse shriveling until it shrinks to the size of a child. Denied the respect of a burial that would smooth his spirit's transition to the afterlife, he is unable to leave the mortal plane and enter the realm of the spirits. Forgotten, lost, and miserable, suffering from unbearable hunger and cold, the little man in the woods is desperate to return to his mortal home and be laid to rest properly.

Despite his understandable motives, the little man in the woods has degenerated into a foul, twisted creature. He deceives travelers with plaintive cries then begs them to lead him to a home he barely recalls. He strangles all who can't or won't aid him, including those who lead him to the wrong home or otherwise delay his journey.

The little man in the woods lays his victims' bodies out in the wilds, leaving the corpse unburied and exposed. He guards these rotting corpses over years as they shrivel and decay, until each one rises as another little man in the woods. Like any of the actions he has been compelled to perform, creating more of his kind brings the little man in the woods no pleasure.

action->Voice Imitation.name: Voice Imitation
action->Voice Imitation.description: A little man in the woods can mimic the sounds of a person in distress by attempting a Deception check to Lie. The little man in the woods has a +4 circumstance bonus to this check.

action->Adopt Guise.name: Adopt Guise
action->Adopt Guise.description:
Playing on the expectations of surrounding creatures, the little man in the woods adopts the guise of a Small or Medium living person that matches the voice he imitates. This guise is subjective and entirely in the mind of each creature around him.

A creature that doesn't believe the little man in the woods' voice imitation sees the little man in the woods as he truly is and isn't fooled by Adopt Guise.

action->Strangle.name: Strangle
action->Strangle.description:
Requirements The little man in the woods has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Agarrado} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Neutralizado}

Effect The little man in the woods tightens his grip around the creature's neck, extending the Grab, dealing @Damage[(2d6+3)[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:24|basic:true], and strangling the creature for as long as it remains grabbed or restrained. A strangled creature can't speak, which prevents it from casting spells with a verbal component or activating items with a command component. The strangled creature must hold its breath or start suffocating.

Llorona.name: Llorona
Llorona.publicNotes:
Vengeful spirits called lloronas arise from people who died overcome with the grief and shame that comes with the tragic drowning of a child. In life, a llorona may have contributed to the child's death or simply lost the child to a horrible accident. In death, a llorona's pain manifests as a malevolent desire to drown others, imparting the same grief that they share with the person's loved ones. To this end, lloronas remain along riversides and other bodies of water in hopes of drawing their next victim and compelling them to drown themselves.

Lloronas look much like they did in life, except they wear elegant funeral attire in undeath. Though stories typically describe lloronas as women, reports from seasoned adventurers include accounts of lloronas appearing as different genders and with a variety of appearances.

action->Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
action->Rejuvenation.description: When a llorona is destroyed, they re-form after [[/gmr 1d6 #days]]{1d6 days} at the site of their death. Resolving the injustice that led to a llorona's death puts them to rest permanently. Alternatively, successfully performing a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Dbd5W6G8U2vzWolN]{Consecrate} ritual at the site prevents them from re-forming.

action->Constrict.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.g26YiEIfSHCpLocV]

@Damage[(2d6+12)[void]] @Check[type:fortitude|dc:31|basic:true]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Constrict]

action->Funereal Touch.name: Funereal Touch
action->Funereal Touch.description: A creature touched by a llorona must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:29] save. On a failure, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drenado 1} (drained 2 on a critical failure) or increases their drained value by 1 (2 on a critical failure), up to a maximum of drained 4. Every time a creature becomes drained in this way, the llorona gains 10 temporary Hit Points for 1 hour.

action->Ghostly Grasp.name: Ghostly Grasp
action->Ghostly Grasp.description: A llorona can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} corporeal creatures despite being incorporeal. The llorona uses their Athletics check to Grapple as normal but can't use Athletics for other actions that require corporeal contact, like Force Open or Trip.

action->Wail.name: Wail
action->Wail.description:
The llorona unleashes a somber wail. Each living creature within @Template[type:emanation|distance:120]{120 feet} must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:31] save. Regardless of its result, the creature is then temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Aturdido 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinado} with the nearest body of water and compelled to move toward the water and drown itself. If there's no nearby body of water, the creature instead remains still. The creature can attempt another @Check[type:will|dc:31] save at the end of each of its turns. On a success, the creature is no longer fascinated. Once the fascinated condition ends, the creature becomes stunned 1.

Critical Failure As failure, except the creature receives another Will save only at the end of a round in which it's submerged in water.

Locking Door.name: Puerta que se cierra
Locking Door.description: Una puerta (u otro portal) se cierra de golpe y se bloquea.
Locking Door.disable: @Check[athletics|dc:14|name:Empujar la puerta] para empujar la puerta, @Check[crafting|dc:14|name:Poner una cuña en la puerta] para poner una cuña en la puerta que la mantenga abierta, o @Check[thievery|dc:20|name:Atascar la cerradura] (entrenada) para atascar la cerradura para que siga abierta o abrirla posteriormente.
Locking Door.stealth: para notar que la puerta se mueve levemente, incluso sin haber brisa alguna.

action->Shut In.name: Encerrado
action->Shut In.description:
Desencadenante Una criatura acaba su movimiento tras pasar por el portal

Efecto Con una brisa etérea en el aire, la puerta chirría dando un portazo y cerrándose con llave. La puerta embrujada empuja a cualquiera en su espacio a una casilla adyacente en la habitación. Una criatura que sería empujada ha de tener éxito en una salvación de @Check[reflex|dc:16] para elegir a qué lado de la puerta acabar.

Minister Of Tumult.name: Minister Of Tumult
Minister Of Tumult.hpDetails: fast healing 10, void healing, one more breath
Minister Of Tumult.publicNotes:
Jiang-shi are terrifying hopping vampires from Tian Xia. Though similar to other vampires—they are undead, drain vital energy from the living, and can be slain only in specific ways—jiang-shi feast upon the breath of the living, also known as qi or ki, instead of blood. While they possess unique powers, including their magic-deflecting paper fulus, extraordinary jumping ability, and immunity to sunlight, jiang-shi also possess unique vulnerabilities, such as the inability to see living creatures save through breathsense, a revulsion to bells and mirrors, and near-stupefying melancholia. Thankfully, most jiang-shi can't create vampiric spawn.

Ministers of tumult are grandmasters of killing, having cultivated their prowess to supernatural levels through the qi reaved from countless mortals. Many such jiang-shi ministers rule over settlements or even entire city-states, cowing their subjects into unerring obedience.

A settlement or city-state under the control of a minister of tumult typically seems, on the outside, like everything is running smoothly and with clockwork precision. Guard patrols, street cleanings, carriages, and more always arrive precisely at the designated time, neither early nor late. To a visitor who doesn't pay any heed to the unease behind the smiles on the inhabitants' faces, the minister of tumult's fiefdom might appear to be a marvelous place to live. But the truth is much more dire. Ministers of tumult keep control and engorge themselves with qi by draining qi from criminals. If the minister of tumult is hungry and there haven't been any serious crimes, they simply dole out this punishment for petty crimes, minor infractions, or simple failures to perform adequately. This keeps the people in check, as there always seems to be a way to avoid the penalty by acting perfectly.

action->Drain Qi.name: Drain Qi
action->Drain Qi.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.QMlQ5AvcunCvjlfM]

Requirements A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Agarrado}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralizado}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Neutralizado}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Inconsciente}, or willing creature is within the jiang-shi's reach

Effect The jiang-shi drains the victim's life energy, or qi, through their breath. This requires an @Check[type:athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions. The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drenado 1} and the jiang-shi regains [[/r 19[healing]]]{19 HP}, gaining any excess as temporary Hit Points. Draining qi from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the jiang-shi but increases the victim's drained condition value by 1, killing the victim when it reaches drained 5. If the victim has the ability to cast ki spells, it can spend 1 Focus Point to avoid becoming drained. This protects it only from the current attack, not from subsequent attempts to Drain Qi.

A victim's drained condition value decreases by 1 every week. If the creature restricts their diet to glutinous rice for at least 1 day and spends 10 minutes dancing, jogging, or otherwise engaging in vigorous physical activity by succeeding at a @Check[type:athletics|dc:25] check, it reduces its drained condition by 1.

action->Premonition of Death.name: Premonition of Death
action->Premonition of Death.description:
Trigger The minister rolls initiative or their turn begins

Effect The minister is attuned to coming violence. The minister uses Stance of Death.

action->Stance of Death.name: Stance of Death
action->Stance of Death.description:
The minister's qi-engorged form allows perfect body control at all times. They assume one of the following stances.

  • Bone Corpse When the minister successfully Drains Qi while in this stance, for 1 round each time the drained creature Strides it must succeed at a @Check[type:flat|dc:5] or waste the action and fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Tumbado}.
  • Cloudless Void The jiang-shi gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC and their claw Strikes gain the reach trait.
  • Sundered Veins Creatures struck by the jiang-shi's claw Strikes take 1d10 persistent bleed damage. On a critical hit, they are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Debilitado 1}.

Mummified Cat.name: Mummified Cat
Mummified Cat.publicNotes:
Some of the wealthy have their favored pets mummified or wish to use the animal's fractured memories but strong instincts and natural weapons to turn them into formidable tomb guardians. No other animal was so trusted in the afterlife as felines, who were almost without exception buried alongside deceased pharaohs. Though small in stature, a clowder of mummified cats has ended the life of many a would-be tomb robber

The versatility of mummification allows the creation of mummies through a wide range of methods—nature, ritual, alchemy, and combinations of all these.

action->Aura of Repose.name: Aura of Repose
action->Aura of Repose.description: 60 feet. Corpses within the aura don't decay. This aura also attempts to counteract any effect that would transform a creature in the aura into undead (counteract rank 2, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+5 #Counteract]]{+5}).

action->Pounce.name: Pounce
action->Pounce.description: The mummified cat Strides and makes a Strike at the end of its movement. If the mummified cat began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Escondido}, it remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.

action->Sneak Attack.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.AWvNPE4U0kEJSL1T]

The mummified cat deals an additional 1d4 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido} creatures.

Mummy Prophet Of Set.name: Mummy Prophet Of Set
Mummy Prophet Of Set.languages: any two languages they knew while alive
Mummy Prophet Of Set.publicNotes:
In ancient Osirion, worshipers completely devoted to the evil god Set often underwent a mummification process to serve as his prophets after their death.

The versatility of mummification allows the creation of mummies through a wide range of methods—nature, ritual, alchemy, and combinations of all these.
Mummy Prophet Of Set.saveDetails: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

equipment->Religious Symbol of Set.name: Religious Symbol of Set
equipment->Religious Symbol of Set.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

action->Great Despair.name: Great Despair
action->Great Despair.description:
30 feet. Living creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Asustado 1} while in an mummy prophet's great despair aura. They can't naturally recover from this fear while in the area but recover instantly once they leave it. When a creature first enters the area, it must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:31] save (after taking the penalty from being frightened) or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralizado} for [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. The creature is then temporarily immune for 24 hours.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.1bOSJ2LbEC28aI9f]{Effect: Despair}

action->Sand Vision.name: Sand Vision
action->Sand Vision.description: The prophet ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Oculto} condition from particles of sand and dust in the air.

action->Breath of Sand.name: Breath of Sand
action->Breath of Sand.description:
Requirements The prophet's Sandstorm is active

Effect The prophet inhales its Sandstorm, suppressing the effect until the end of the prophet's next turn. It then exhales a @Template[type:cone|distance:120] of negatively charged sand that deals @Damage[7d6[void],7d6[slashing]]{7d6 void and 7d6 slashing damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:33|basic:true]).

action->Channel Rot.name: Channel Rot
action->Channel Rot.description: The mummy prophet of Set can deliver devastating rot through melee weapons they wield.

action->Sand Form.name: Sand Form
action->Sand Form.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The prophet loses their coherent from and becomes an animated pile of sand. While in this form, the prophet gains resistance 10 to physical damage and is immune to precision damage. They can't cast spells, activate items, or use actions that have the attack or manipulate trait. They gain a fly Speed of 40 feet and can slip through tiny cracks. This lasts for 5 minutes, and the prophet can Dismiss the effect.

action->Sand Rot.name: Sand Rot
action->Sand Rot.description:
This affliction can't be reduced below stage 1, nor can damage from it be healed, until successfully treated with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SUKaxVZW2TlM8lu0]{Cleanse Affliction} or a similar effect; the affliction can then be removed as normal for a disease. A creature killed by sand rot turns to sand and can't be resurrected except by a 7th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kqhPt9344UkcGVYO]{Resurrect} ritual or similar magic

Saving Throw@Check[type:fortitude|dc:31]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 minute)

Stage 2 @Damage[12d6[void]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Torpe 1}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Anonadado 2} (1 day)

action->Sandstorm.name: Sandstorm
action->Sandstorm.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The mummy creates a temporary sandstorm in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] that lasts for 1 minute. Creatures within the emanation take a -4 circumstance penalty to Perception checks and must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:33] save or be forced to hold their breath or start suffocating. A creature within the sandstorm at the end of its turn takes @Damage[2d6[void],1d6[slashing]]{2d6 void and 1d6 slashing damage}.

Obrousian.name: Obrousian
Obrousian.publicNotes:
Spawned from sorrow and hatred, obrousians are undead merfolk who lurk in shallow places to prey upon hated land dwellers. The genesis of an obrousian is a tragic one: some merfolk forsake their aquatic homes when they fall in love with a land dweller, only to be spurned or rejected. Having given up their entire world for another and then feeling that new world closed off to them as well, merfolk can become emotionally overwhelmed. When such merfolk die, often overcome with sorrow and regret, they rise as obrousians.

Obrousians think of little other than taking revenge upon the land dwellers who specifically wronged them, and then upon anyone else with the misfortune to cross their paths. They can contort their bodies to take the guise of other humanoids, but doing so is painful, so obrousians use this ability only when absolutely necessary to enact their schemes. While they are capable of long-term planning, their underlying mental turmoil simmers beneath any careful preparation, and many obrousians foil their own plans with unexpected outbursts of emotion.

Obrousians are recognizable as the merfolk they once were before they died, though their bodies show obvious decay and their hands have elongated into sharp claws. Their voices are melodic and entrancing, belying their rotting bodies and turbulent minds, so some obrousians hide in tall reeds or under docks before speaking to their victims, lulling them into false comfort with a pleasant voice.

action->Waves of Sorrow.name: Waves of Sorrow
action->Waves of Sorrow.description: 30 feet. When a creature ends its turn in the obrousian's waves of sorrow aura, the creature is overwhelmed by the sorrow that suffuses the obrousian's being.
