After using Ghostly Swoop, the sluagh reaper can't use it again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Ghostly Swoop]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Sneak Attack.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.AWvNPE4U0kEJSL1T]

The sluagh reaper deals an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido} creatures.

action->Steal Soul.name: Steal Soul
action->Steal Soul.description:
The sluagh reaper touches a dying creature or a creature that died within the past 1 hour. If the target is a dying creature, it must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28] save-on a failure, its dying value increases by 1 (2 on a critical failure). If the target is dead, it receives no save and the sluagh imprisons its soul in a small, grimy sack that keeps stolen souls fresh.

The sack is magically locked. Any sluagh can open it without difficulty, but any others must @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2EE4aF4SZpYf0R6H]{Pick the Lock} (@Check[type:thievery|dc:35|traits:action:pick-a-lock]) or use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (5th level; counteract DC 32). A creature can Interact to empty an unlocked sack, which frees the souls but doesn't return them to life. While a soul is imprisoned, it can't be brought back to life by any means short of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.YfJTXyVGzLhM6V8U]{Miracle}. The sack can hold 12 souls at a time. Sluagh reapers typically attempt to return the souls to a queen so she can devour them.

Spirit Cyclone.name: Ciclón espiritual
Spirit Cyclone.description: Un ciclón de espíritus furiosos aparece en el área.
Spirit Cyclone.disable: @Check[occultism|dc:30] (entrenado) o @Check[religion|dc:30] (entrenado) para debilitar la aparición; se necesitan tres éxitos en cualquier combinación para inutilizar la aparición.
Spirit Cyclone.reset: El ciclón espiritual se dispersa tras 1 minuto y se rearma en 1 día.
Spirit Cyclone.routine: (3 acciones) El ciclón espiritual usa tres acciones para moverse, viajando hasta 30 pies (9 m) con cada acción y causando @Damage[(2d10+13)[void]]{2d10+13 daño del vacío} a cada criatura en su camino (salvación @Check[reflex|dc:32|basic]). Una criatura solo necesita tener éxito en una salvación, aunque el ciclón se mueva por su espacio más de una vez. Con un fallo crítico, la criatura es arrastrada por el ciclón, quedando @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Agarrada} ([[/act escape dc=32]]). Una criatura agarrada por el ciclón se mueve con él y sufre @Damage[(1d10+6)[void]]{1d10+6 daño del vacío} adicional al inicio de su turno, debe realizar una salvación de Reflejos contra el ciclón en el turno de éste sin importar si el ciclón se mueve o no. Una criatura que Huye con éxito del ciclón cae de una altura de [[/r {1d12*5} #Falling Distance]]{1d12 x 5 pies (1,5 - 18 m)}.

action->Gather Spirit.name: Copngregar espíritus
action->Gather Spirit.description:
Desencadenante Dos o más criaturas entran en el área

Efecto Una columna de espíritus en espiral se congrega, convirtiéndose en un ciclón de almas de @Template[burst|distance:5]{10 pies (3 m) de ancho} y 60 pies (18 m) de alto. Tras esto, la aparición tira iniciativa.

Taunting Skull.name: Cráneo burlón
Taunting Skull.languages: otro idioma cualquiera hablado en vida
Taunting Skull.publicNotes:
Algunos decapitados se alzan con sus facultades mentales prácticamente intactas. Estos astutos muertos vivientes a menudo provocan a sus víctimas para que los persigan alocadamente o se dañen a sí mismos.

Los decapitados son cabezas incorporales flotantes transformadas en muertos vivientes. Son candidatos naturales para los «proyecto esbirro» de los nigromantes debido a su escaso coste de creación y a su personalización ilimitada. En cualquier guarida ocupada por practicantes de nigromancia durante el tiempo suficiente es común encontrar un puñado de cabezas flotantes vagando por el lugar, cada una exhibiendo características e incluso grados de pericia totalmente diferentes.

action->Bite Back.name: Contraataque de mordisco
action->Bite Back.description:
Desencadenante El cráneo burlón es atacado por una criatura dentro de su alcance

Efecto El cráneo burlón da un Golpe de mandíbulas contra dicha criatura.

action->Incessant Goading.name: Provocación constante
action->Incessant Goading.description:
La calavera elige a una criatura dentro de una emanación de 60 pies (18 m) y la provoca sin piedad. El objetivo debe tener éxito en una prueba de salvación de @Check[will|dc:22] para resistir el efecto.

Éxito crítico El objetivo no se ve afectado y es inmune temporalmente durante 1 minuto.

Éxito El objetivo no se ve afectado.

Fallo El objetivo queda @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido} 1 asalto. En su próximo turno, si el cráneo burlón está dentro de su alcance, el objetivo le ataca salvajemente tantas veces como puede.

Fallo crítico Como fallo, pero además el objetivo da un Golpe contra sí mismo; este Golpe no cuenta como una acción.

Toppling Furniture.name: Derribo de muebles
Toppling Furniture.description: Un espíritu travieso empuja una estantería sobre una criatura.
Toppling Furniture.disable: @Check[athletics|dc:16|name:Sujetar el mueble] para sujetar el mueble u @Check[occultism|dc:18|name:Frustrar los intentos del espíritu] (entrenada) para frustrar los intentos del espíritu de influir en la materia
Toppling Furniture.reset: Si la aparición daña a una criatura, el espíritu se ríe durante [[/gmr 1d4 #Duración de la risa]]{1d4 asaltos} mientras la aparición se rearma; cada vez que se active la aparición de nuevo, deberá derribar un mueble diferente que esté en pie. Si la aparición no daña a la criatura, el espíritu gime de frustración y lo rearma tras hacer pucheros durante [[/gmr 1d4 #Rearme aparición]]{1d4 horas}.
Toppling Furniture.stealth: (entrenada) para oír al espíritu gruñir por el esfuerzo mientras trata de derribar los muebles.

action->Topple Furniture.name: Derribo de mueble
action->Topple Furniture.description:
Desencadenante Una criatura se mueve adyacente al mueble

Efecto El espíritu vuelca el mueble en un intento de aplastar a la criatura desencadenante. La criatura desencadenante sufre @Damage[(2d10+7)[bludgeoning]]{2d10+7 daño contundente} (salvación @Check[reflex|dc:22|basic]). Con un fallo, la criatura además queda @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Tumbada}.

Tormented (Burning).name: Tormented (Burning)
Tormented (Burning).publicNotes: Twisted caricatures of living beings, tormented arise from the remains of those who've been tortured to death. They appear as the mortals they were in life, horribly disfigured by acts of cruelty. Unable to rest, they haunt the sites of their deaths, doomed to relive their last moments of agony. The toxic psychic residue of their death is so great it spills over, afflicting anyone who meets the tormented's haunted gaze.

action->Endless Suffering.name: Endless Suffering
action->Endless Suffering.description: The tormented perished by fire and brand.

action->Tortured Gaze.name: Tortured Gaze
action->Tortured Gaze.description:
30 foot or 60 foot if the tormented is at 125 HP or lower.

The psychic agony of a tormented spills into the world around them, inflicting murderous hallucinations replicating the tormented's last moments. A non-undead creature that ends its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:32] save or take @Damage[6d6[fire]] damage and be wreathed in ghostly flames for 1 minute, negating its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Oculto} condition and rendering it concealed if it would be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. While it has a condition from Tortured Gaze, a creature can't gain a new condition from the aura but can take damage from it again.

action->Scream in Agony.name: Scream in Agony
action->Scream in Agony.description:
Each creature in the tormented's Tortured Gaze aura takes @Damage[14d6[mental]] damage (@Check[type:will|dc:34|basic:true]). A creature that fails is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Indispuesto 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Indispuesto 2} on a critical failure).

The tormented can't Scream in Agony again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Scream in Agony]]{1d4 rounds}, but recharges the ability whenever they take damage from an attacker's critical hit or their own critical failure on a saving throw.

Tormented (Starvation).name: Tormented (Starvation)
Tormented (Starvation).publicNotes: Twisted caricatures of living beings, tormented arise from the remains of those who've been tortured to death. They appear as the mortals they were in life, horribly disfigured by acts of cruelty. Unable to rest, they haunt the sites of their deaths, doomed to relive their last moments of agony. The toxic psychic residue of their death is so great it spills over, afflicting anyone who meets the tormented's haunted gaze.

action->Endless Suffering.name: Endless Suffering
action->Endless Suffering.description: The tormented starved to death, denied food until the end.

action->Tortured Gaze.name: Tortured Gaze
action->Tortured Gaze.description:
30 foot or 60 foot if the tormented is at 125 HP or lower.

The psychic agony of a tormented spills into the world around them, inflicting murderous hallucinations replicating the tormented's last moments. A non-undead creature that ends its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:32] save or for 1 minute, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Debilitado 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigado}. While it has a condition from Tortured Gaze, a creature can't gain a new condition from the aura but can take damage from it again.

action->Scream in Agony.name: Scream in Agony
action->Scream in Agony.description:
Each creature in the tormented's Tortured Gaze aura takes @Damage[14d6[mental]] damage (@Check[type:will|dc:34|basic:true]). A creature that fails is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Indispuesto 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Indispuesto 2} on a critical failure).

The tormented can't Scream in Agony again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Scream in Agony]]{1d4 rounds}, but recharges the ability whenever they take damage from an attacker's critical hit or their own critical failure on a saving throw.

Vetalarana Emergent.name: Vetalarana Emergent
Vetalarana Emergent.hpDetails: fast healing 10, mental rebirth, void healing
Vetalarana Emergent.publicNotes:
Vetalarana vampires feed on the emotions, thoughts, and memories of others. Although they are capable of feeding on animals, beings of the planes, and other intelligent undead, only the thoughts of an intelligent, living humanoid bring a vetalarana any sense of satisfaction. Slender and pale, with sunken cheeks and exceptionally long nails, vetalaranas become flushed with color and life after feeding on particularly potent emotions and thoughts, enabling some to pass as living for a short time.

A vetalarana is created when a person with psychic or occult abilities dies in denial of their death, refusing to pass on to the afterlife but unable to retain their grip on life. As their spirit has no cause left undone nor debt to settle, these tenacious souls rise not as ghosts but as vetalaranas, a formidable and tenacious mind animating their own corpse in a mockery of life.

A vetalarana's predations inevitably turn their victims into living husks, incapable of thought and devoid of any spark of personality. These victims fall into a senseless stupor, comatose but still living, without identity or memories. If a vetalarana is killed, they can occupy one of these comatose husks, while more powerful vetalaranas can control them like living puppets.

When a vetalarana is destroyed, all of their comatose victims are immediately freed. Most often, these people regain consciousness as amnesiacs whose memories return over time—taking at least months but sometimes as long as decades. These returned memories are fragmented and often jumbled with the thoughts of others the vetalarana fed upon. If a victim served as a failed host or was frequently controlled while comatose, a sliver of the vetalarana's corrupted thoughts remain in the victim's mind. These tainted victims recover much faster than their fellows, regaining their memories in record time and transforming into a new vetalarana soon after.

A vetalarana emergent is inexperienced and ravenous, often caring more for the consumption of thoughts than the quality of the thoughts and memories consumed. These undead gluttons gorge themselves on memories, leaving a crowd of addled and terrified victims in their wake. Experienced emergents are cannier than their newly risen kin, stalking their chosen victims and being sure to abduct, kill, or render their victims comatose after draining their memories to ensure no witnesses remain to reveal the presence of a vetalarana.

action->Anticipatory Attack.name: Anticipatory Attack
action->Anticipatory Attack.description: The vetalarana emergent uses consumed memories to anticipate their prey's movements. The vetalarana emergent's Strikes deal an additional 1d8 precision damage to creatures stupefied due to the vetalarana's Drain Thoughts.

action->Drain Thoughts.name: Drain Thoughts
action->Drain Thoughts.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.EpDyZ0mG9beLkBna]

Requirements A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Agarrado}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralizado}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Neutralizado}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Inconsciente}, or willing creature is within the vetalarana's reach

Effect The vetalarana seizes a creature and consumes its memories. This requires an @Check[type:athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions. The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Anonadado 1}, and the vetalarana regains [[/r 10[healing]]]{10 HP}, gaining any excess as temporary Hit Points. Draining Thoughts from a creature that is already stupefied doesn't restore any HP to the vetalarana but increases the victim's stupefied value by 1. Additionally, the vetalarana views one of the victim's memories.

A victim's stupefied condition value decreases by 1 every week.

A victim that becomes stupefied 5 in this way is rendered comatose, becoming permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Inconsciente}. As long as the vetalarana lives, a comatose victim can't regain consciousness, and its stupefied condition doesn't decrease.

Vetalarana Manipulator.name: Vetalarana Manipulator
Vetalarana Manipulator.hpDetails: fast healing 10, mental rebirth, void healing

These tainted victims recover much faster than their fellows, regaining their memories in record time and transforming into a new vetalarana soon after.

A vetalarana manipulator is a gifted strategist, empowered by the memories, thoughts, and talents the manipulator has drained from countless victims and honed by centuries of survival. Certain of their own superiority, manipulators twist free-willed individuals for their own ends as easily as they control their comatose puppets.

action->Psychic Superiority.name: Psychic Superiority
action->Psychic Superiority.description:
Trigger A creature targets the vetalarana manipulator with a mental effect or spell

Effect The manipulator psychically lashes out at the triggering creature, dealing @Damage[3d8[mental]] damage (@Check[type:will|dc:24|basic:true]).

action->Drain Thoughts.name: Drain Thoughts
action->Drain Thoughts.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.EpDyZ0mG9beLkBna]

action->Paralyzing Claws.name: Paralyzing Claws
action->Paralyzing Claws.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.yfNDFjz7VBvvLwee]

Any living creature hit by a vetalarana manipulator's claw Strike must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralizado}. The target can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns to end the effect, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

Violent Shove.name: Empujón violento
Violent Shove.description: Una fuerza invisible empuja a un lado a las criaturas, lanzándolas contra la pared más cercana.
Violent Shove.disable: @Check[occultism|dc:19|name:Dispersar la fuerza] (entrenada) para dispersar la fuerza o @Check[religion|dc:20|name:Protegerte del daño] (entrenada) para protegerte del daño.
Violent Shove.stealth: (entrenada) para sentir una presencia ominosa en la habitación.

action->Shove.name: Empujón
action->Shove.description:
Desencadenante Una criatura se mueve adyacente a la pared embrujada

Efecto Una poderosa fuerza recorre la habitación, empujando a todas las criaturas hacia la pared. Cada criatura debe realizar una salvación de Fortaleza CD 20.

Éxito crítico La criatura no sufre ningún efecto.

Éxito La criatura es empujada 5 pies (1,5 m) hacia la pared. Si choca contra la pared, sufre @Damage[(1d10+5)[bludgeoning]]{1d10+5 daño contundente}.

Fallo La criatura es empujada 10 pies (3 m) hacia la pared. Si choca contra la pared, sufre @Damage[(2d10+10)[bludgeoning]]{2d10+10 daño contundente}.

Fallo crítico La criatura es empujada 15 pies (4,5 m) hacia la pared. Si choca contra la pared, sufre @Damage[(3d10+15)[bludgeoning]]{3d10+15 daño contundente} y queda @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Tumbada}.

Waldgeist.name: Waldgeist
Waldgeist.publicNotes:
Waldgeists act as avatars of nature that seek vengeance for environmental abuse, such as pollution and deforestation. These undead spirits of destroyed trees form at the site of their destruction or in a nearby woodland, if the original location was entirely razed. They become guardians of the forest, possessing power over the plants within its boundaries. Waldgeists show no mercy to anyone caught damaging their bonded woodland, attacking loggers, fey, travelers, and invasive species with equal prejudice.

When disaster befalls the natural world, a different kind of undead may rise, entirely unlike risen humanoids. Most plants, fish, insects, and other animals don't possess a psychology complex enough to experience the emotional catharsis required to return as undead without intervention from an outside force. Mass extinction can serve as that outside force.

Humanoids clear-cutting an entire forest or a seaside community wiping out a species critical to their ecosystem can spawn a verdorite. The collective spiritual energy and emotional distress of a dying biome powers these undead, formed as conglomerates or representatives.

action->Forest Guardian.name: Forest Guardian
action->Forest Guardian.description: A waldgeist is compelled to investigate the sound of wood or trees being damaged, such as by being burned or chopped down. A waldgeist that hears such a sound must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:26] save or spend all their actions moving toward the sound until they identify the cause. This can't be used to compel a waldgeist to leave their bonded woodland. A waldgeist that succeeds at their saving throw is temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

action->Woodland Dependent.name: Woodland Dependent
action->Woodland Dependent.description: A waldgeist is mystically bonded to a single forest, jungle, orchard, grove, or other similar large, wooded area and must remain within it. If the waldgeist moves outside their bonded woodland, they're immediately destroyed.

action->Lignify.name: Lignify
action->Lignify.description: The touch of a waldgeist transforms flesh into wood. A living creature damaged by the waldgeist's lignifying hand Strike must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:24] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Lentificado 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Lentificado 2} on a critical failure). Further failed saves against lignify increases the slowed condition. Once a creature's actions are reduced to 0 by lignify, that creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrificado}, except they're transformed into wood instead of stone.

action->Possess Tree.name: Possess Tree
action->Possess Tree.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect The waldgeist touches a tree to merge with it, possessing it for up to 1 minute. They can end this possession early as a free action at the start of their turn. While the waldgeist possesses a tree, they lose the incorporeal trait, fly Speed, all resistances, their non-constant spells, and their lignifying hand Strike. Additionally, their size increases to Huge, they gain resistance 5 to bludgeoning and piercing damage, weakness 10 to fire, Speed 20 feet, and the following branch Strike.

Melee 1 branch (reach 15 feet) +20, Damage 2d12+9 bludgeoning.

While a waldgeist possesses a tree, any damage that would be dealt to the waldgeist is instead dealt to the tree. The tree has 60 Hit Points. When the tree is reduced to 0 Hit Points, the waldgeist is immediately ejected, and the tree is destroyed.

lore->Woodland Lore (Applies Only to the.name: Woodland Lore (Applies Only to the Woodland the Waldgeist is Bonded To)

Weight of Guilt.name: El peso de la culpa
Weight of Guilt.description: Las criaturas, influidas por la culpa y el remordimiento de los muertos, son envueltas por cadenas que representan sus propios pecados.
Weight of Guilt.disable: @Check[religion|dc:26|name:Dispersar la aparición] (experto) para dispersar la aparición mediante la oración o @Check[deception|dc:27|name:Desafiar abiertamente tus remordimientos] (experto) para desafiar abiertamente tus remordimientos y desterrar la aparición. Las criaturas que no han cometido pecados o que han hecho penitencia por sus transgresiones son inmunes a los efectos de este aparición.
Weight of Guilt.stealth: (experto) para sentir una opresiva aura de pena.

action->Mental Bind.name: Atadura mental
action->Mental Bind.description:
Desencadenante Una criatura entra en el área

Efecto Cada criatura en 30 pies (9 m) queda envuelta en pesadas cadenas espectrales forjadas a partir de sus propios pecados y remordimientos. Cada una debe tener éxito en una salvación de @Check[will|dc:25].

Éxito crítico La criatura no sufre ningún efecto.

Éxito La criatura sufre un penalizador -10 pies (3 m) por estatus a la Velocidad durante 1 asalto.

Fallo La criatura queda @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Neutralizada} hasta que [[/act escape dc=25]]{Huye} (CD 25).

Fallo crítico Como el fallo, pero la criatura queda abrumada por la culpa, quedando @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Anonadada 2} durante 1 día.

Wight Commander.name: Wight Commander
Wight Commander.publicNotes:
When the beloved leader of a military unit is raised as a wight, sometimes the spirits of their comrades return with them, creating a gestalt being of impeccable tactical acumen.

Wights are undead beings of spite who primarily stalk places related to death.

weapon->Longsword.description: Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.

shield->Steel Shield.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Yr9yCuJiAlFh3QEB]

Like wooden shields, steel shields come in a variety of shapes and sizes. Though more expensive than wooden shields, they are much more durable.

Hardness HP BT
5 20 10

armor->Full Plate.description: Plate mail consists of interlocking plates that encase nearly the entire body in a carapace of steel. It is costly and heavy, and the wearer often requires help to don it correctly, but it provides some of the best defense armor can supply. A suit of this armor comes with an undercoat of padded armor and a pair of gauntlets.

action->Final Spite.name: Final Spite
action->Final Spite.description:
Trigger The wight commander is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The wight commander blows a battered war horn before being destroyed. The unnerving blast summons reinforcements, raising [[/r 1d4 #Corpses]]{1d4 corpses} in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:200] as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.ZPjQkKVMi3xoPcU0]{Wights}.

action->Coordinated Strike.name: Coordinated Strike
action->Coordinated Strike.description: The wight commander flanks with an ally as long as the target is within both their reaches, even if commander and ally aren't on opposite sides.

action->Drain Life.name: Drain Life
action->Drain Life.description: When the hunter wight damages a living creature using an unarmed attack or their bound weapon, they gain 12 temporary Hit Points, and the creature must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:29] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drenado 1}. Further damage dealt by the hunter wight's unarmed and bound weapon attacks increases the value of the drained condition by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

action->Spawn Wight Soldier.name: Spawn Wight Soldier
action->Spawn Wight Soldier.description: A living humanoid killed by a wight commander's weapon or claw Strike rises as a wight of the commander's level or lower, most often a hunter wight or prowler wight, after [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. This spawn is under the command of the wight commander that killed them. They don't have drain life or spawn wight soldier and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Torpe 2} for as long as they're a wight spawn. If the creator of the wight spawn dies, the wight spawn becomes a fully autonomous wight; they regain their free will, gain drain life and spawn wight soldier, and are no longer clumsy.

action->Tactical Direction.name: Tactical Direction
action->Tactical Direction.description: Each wight ally in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.hFtNbo1LKYCoDy2O]{Attack of Opportunity} reaction until the end of their next turn.

Withered.name: Withered
Withered.publicNotes:
If a husk zombie survives for several years, their body continues to dry out, their flesh hardens, and their eyes turn into pale, glowing orbs set deep into otherwise empty sockets. Known as the withered, these zombies are cunning, capable of forming complex plans and even setting traps utilizing their less-intelligent brethren to lure the unsuspecting into deadly ambushes.

Simple to create and varied in purpose, these shambling undead are often used for their strength and endless stamina to conduct boring, repetitive tasks.

condition->Slowed.description: You have fewer actions. Slowed always includes a value. When you regain your actions at the start of your turn, reduce the number of actions you regain by your slowed value. Because slowed has its effect at the start of your turn, you don't immediately lose actions if you become slowed during your turn.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A withered is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Lentificado 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Sneak Attack.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.AWvNPE4U0kEJSL1T]

The withered zombie deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido} creatures.

action->Sudden Surge.name: Sudden Surge
action->Sudden Surge.description:
Trigger The husk zombie's turn begins

Effect The withered has a sudden burst of speed. They are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Acelerado} this turn and can use the extra action only to Stride or Strike. If the withered's first action this turn is a melee Strike, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido} against the attack.

The withered can't use Sudden Surge for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Sudden Surge]]{1d4 rounds}.

Zombie Lord.name: Zombie Lord
Zombie Lord.publicNotes:
Cunning zombie lords command their lesser kin, which they can use in unexpected ways. They have been known to direct or collaborate with husk and withered zombies, creating cells of intelligent zombies hiding within the ranks of mindless undead.

Simple to create and varied in purpose, these shambling undead are often used for their strength and endless stamina to conduct boring, repetitive tasks.

action->Command Zombie.name: Command Zombie
action->Command Zombie.description:
The zombie lord intones blasphemous words to gain control over a zombie they can see within 100 feet. A zombie that is mindless and not under someone else's control falls under their control automatically; otherwise, the zombie or its controller can attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:22] save to avoid it being controlled (whichever has the higher modifier). The target zombie is temporarily immune for 24 hours if successful. The attempt fails if the zombie is the same level as the zombie lord or higher

The zombie remains controlled by the zombie lord until either is destroyed. A zombie lord can control up to 8 zombies at a time. If the zombie lord would control a number of zombies over this limit, they choose which to release.

action->Create Zombies.name: Create Zombies
action->Create Zombies.description: A zombie lord can create lesser zombies with a 1-hour ritual. During this time, the zombie lord chants and performs an unholy dance over the corpses they intend to animate. Unlike normal rituals, this doesn't require a skill check or cost. At the end of this hour, the zombie lord can create one 1st- or 2nd-level zombie, or two zombies of level 0 or lower. These are automatically under the zombie lord's control and count toward the limit of Command Zombie. Any zombies created by the zombie lord still count toward the XP budget of an encounter normally.

action->Shamble Forth!.name: Shamble Forth!
action->Shamble Forth!.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Each zombie controlled by the zombie lord Strides 5 feet (or Burrows, Climbs, Flies, or Swims 5 feet if it has the corresponding movement type).

Zombie Mammoth.name: Zombie Mammoth
Zombie Mammoth.publicNotes:
This monstrous creature can overrun defenses and stomp foes into the ground, making it a terror on any battlefield.

Simple to create and varied in purpose, these shambling undead are often used for their strength and endless stamina to conduct boring, repetitive tasks.

condition->Slowed.description: You have fewer actions. Slowed always includes a value. When you regain your actions at the start of your turn, reduce the number of actions you regain by your slowed value. Because slowed has its effect at the start of your turn, you don't immediately lose actions if you become slowed during your turn.

action->Severed Trunk.name: Severed Trunk
action->Severed Trunk.description:
When the zombie mammoth is hit by a critical hit that deals slashing damage, the mammoth's trunk is severed from its body. Any creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Agarrado} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Neutralizado} with the trunk is released, and the mammoth loses its trunk Strike and Greater Constrict.

The trunk slithers across the battlefield, still animated, and acts in initiative right after the mammoth. It retains Greater Constrict and trunk Strikes but can't use tusk Strikes, foot Strikes, or Shambling Trample. It has all the stats of the mammoth, except its AC is reduced to 23, it has only 50 Hit Points, and its Speed is 10 feet. Damage dealt to the severed trunk has no effect on the zombie mammoth.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A zombie mammoth is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Lentificado 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Greater Constrict.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.OmV6E3aELvq9CkK1]

@Damage[(2d10+7)[bludgeoning]], @Check[type:fortitude|dc:30|basic:true]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.GreaterConstrict]

action->Shambling Trample.name: Shambling Trample
action->Shambling Trample.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.UNah0bxXxkcZjxO3]

Large or smaller, foot, @Check[type:reflex|dc:30|basic:true]

The zombie mammoth Strides up to its Speed instead of double.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Trample]

Zombie Owlbear.name: Zombie Owlbear
Zombie Owlbear.publicNotes:
Zombie owlbears combine an owlbear's ferocity with mindless undead hatred. Once it draws near, it often stands up, unleashing a guttural, wet roar, before charging into combat without thought of self-preservation.

Simple to create and varied in purpose, these shambling undead are often used for their strength and endless stamina to conduct boring, repetitive tasks.

condition->Slowed.description: You have fewer actions. Slowed always includes a value. When you regain your actions at the start of your turn, reduce the number of actions you regain by your slowed value. Because slowed has its effect at the start of your turn, you don't immediately lose actions if you become slowed during your turn.

On a critical failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Aturdido 1}, and on a critical success the creature is no longer grabbed or restrained.

action->Horrifying Screech.name: Horrifying Screech
action->Horrifying Screech.description:
The zombie owlbear unleashes a broken, snarling screech that unnerves those who hear it. Each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:60] must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:19] save. Regardless of the result, creatures are temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Asustado 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Asustado 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Huyendo} for 1 round and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Asustado 3}.

Zombie Snake.name: Zombie Snake
Zombie Snake.publicNotes:
At around 5 feet long, this massive, rotting serpent lacks potent venom, but its bite still injects putrid fluid that can cause infection.

Simple to create and varied in purpose, these shambling undead are often used for their strength and endless stamina to conduct boring, repetitive tasks.
